channel.title: Item.cfg help
channel.description: On my new computer (win7 64bit), whenever i try to run my server, i always get a itemhandler error. My server was working fine on my old computer (win7 32bit) so i decided to look into my item.cfg. I noticed that after item id 17000 something, the font became simsun instead of courier new. I changed the font, saved, and check it again to make sure it was saved. The font had returned to simsun. Is there a fix to this? my item cfg is 1.9mb, and 0.9mb item.cfg's dont have this problem. I'm assuming it has something to do with my computer.

item.title: Item.cfg help
item.dc:creator: @thock321 thock321
item.description:
@thock321 wrote:

i used wordpad, but it was totally fine for my old computer. Ive tried copying and pasting into a txt document, then saving as .cfg but still no good. Ive opened a txt document with wordpad and it has the same problem.

i get this error:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 17 at server.world.ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:377) at server.world.ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:34) at server.Server.<clinit>(Server.java:65) Press any key to continue . . .
idk why my computer has this problem

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg help
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Your Java files and config files should always be plain text files. Are you using Word? Lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Item.cfg help
item.dc:creator: @thock321 thock321
item.description:
@thock321 wrote:

On my new computer (win7 64bit), whenever i try to run my server, i always get a itemhandler error. My server was working fine on my old computer (win7 32bit) so i decided to look into my item.cfg. I noticed that after item id 17000 something, the font became simsun instead of courier new. I changed the font, saved, and check it again to make sure it was saved. The font had returned to simsun. Is there a fix to this? my item cfg is 1.9mb, and 0.9mb item.cfg’s dont have this problem. I’m assuming it has something to do with my computer.
